article:
A 'leg' is a weight bearing and locomotive structure, usually having a
columnar shape. During locomotion, legs function as "extensible
struts" - the combination of movements at all joints can be modeled
as a single, linear element capable of changing length and rotating about an
omnidirectional "hip" joint.

As an anatomical animal structure it is used for locomotion. The distal end is
often modified to distribute force (such as a foot). Most animals have an even
number of legs.

As a component of furniture it is used for the economy of materials needed to
provide the support for the useful surface, the table top or chair seat.
